page.title: 03Shouldham-A sample of food
page.content: Breakfast consisted of the following- cereals,toast and marmalade.In one or two cases only a drink of coffee or tea. Lunch on the Saturday was usually a makeshift meal such as marmalade and bread,crisps,peanuts,fish and chips, rolls,sandwich,apple and soup perhaps with the family eating at different times.Tea time varied considerably from 4.30 to 7pm.This being a more substantial meal.Things that were eaten were,hotdogs,dumplings,soup, pizza,jacket potatoes,gammon,sausages, sweetcorn and pork slices.The children eat between meals from the variety of sweet snacks and crisps. Drink is either tea,coffee,fizzy drinks or milk. Many had a drink prior to bed. Sunday's food was more traditional- a light breakfast and a main formal meal with all the family. This meal was cooked and mainly eaten about 1pm.
